homura.vision.data.loaders module¶

homura.vision.data.loaders.vision_loaders(name, batch_size, train_da=None, test_da=None, norm=None, val_size=0, download=False, num_workers=- 1, non_training_bs_factor=2, distributed=False, drop_last=False, pin_memory=True, return_num_classes=False, test_batch_size=None)[source]¶

Get data loaders for registered vision datasets. homura expects datasets are in ~/.torch/data/DATASET_NAME. Link path if necessary, e.g. ln -s /original/path $HOME/.torch. Datasets can be registered using homura.vision.register_dataset

Parameters

  • name (str) – name of dataset.

  • batch_size (int) –

  • train_da (Optional[List]) – custom train-time data augmentation

  • test_da (Optional[List]) – custom test-time data augmentation

  • norm (Optional[List]) – custom normalization after train_da/test_da

  • val_size (int) – If val_size>0, split train set

  • download (bool) –

  • num_workers (int) –

  • non_training_bs_factor –

  • distributed (bool) –

  • return_num_classes (bool) –

  • drop_last (bool) –

  • pin_memory (bool) –

  • test_batch_size (Optional[int]) –

Returns

(train_set, test_set, [val_set], [num_classes])

Return type

Tuple

estimates per channel image dataset statistics (mean, stdev)

>>> estimator = PerChannelStatistics(100)
>>> estimator.from_directory("data/images")
>>> estimator.from_batch(img_tensor)
>>> estimator.estimated
